skillTree.localised_description: Orders must be followed and the chain of command honoured; only then will the Great Plan be served.
A low body temperature means the Lizardmen can operate normally in environments which would overwhelm lesser races.
Lizardmen can move with deceptive speed and agility when they have to.
Across the gulf of space, the serene Potec has shared the secrets of time so that the Lizardmen may protect themselves against supernatural attack.
Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Nakai's very presence indicates that a battle of great importance will soon occur.
So many Daemons of Chaos have been slain by Nakai that such entities fear to tread the same ground as him.
Slowly, carefully, the serpent uncoils, before striking suddenly – like lightning – and sinking its fangs as far as they will go.

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.

skillTree.localised_description: Revered as a jungle-spirit made manifest, ancient Nakai is the last of the First Spawning, and fights with the Old Ones' long-dormant fury.

effects.description:
Passive ability: "Frenzy" for Kroxigor and Sacred Kroxigor units
	(Lord's army)

enabled_if: Leadership is higher than 50% of base

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

skillTree.localised_description: Nakai is treated with deference by the Skink Priests, who adorn his massive, battle-scarred body with ceremonial tokens when he returns from the fray.
This mighty protector of the Lizardmen race is pledged to go wherever the Great Plan deems it necessary for him to be.

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit does not suffer any form of leadership loss and will never rout.

skillTree.localised_description: Of course, those who live to kill must also kill to live...
The Plan *will* be observed, even if every member of the younger races has to die to achieve the Old Ones' goals.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +10% when fighting against Skaven
Weapon strength: +10% when fighting against Greenskins, Skaven, Dark Elves, Beastmen, Warriors of Chaos, Daemons of Chaos, Chaos Dwarfs and Norsca

skillTree.localised_description: Creatures with tough hides or some kind of natural armour are tough nuts to crack - even a powerful attack may fall foul of their thick-skin.
"Don't look into their eyes, there is only death there!"
Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
Being able to slow the foe, drain it of energy and the will to fight on, is a mighty power to wield.
Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.
There is nothing but utter belief. There is no reasoning with this one.
What the enemy cannot see, it cannot hit. What the enemy cannot see, it cannot survive.
The enemy aren't going anywhere fast – in fact, they're not going anywhere at all!
There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: A long-serving member of an ancient, honourable tradition.

skillTree.localised_description: Only the finest beast riders can hang on whilst their mounts crash through the jungle undergrowth or smash through the foe's ranks.

skillTree.localised_description: The unforgiving law of the jungle is most clear on matters of ascendancy.

skillTree.localised_description: Braves who emerge from the same spawning often share a deep connection – a bond which provides considerable advantages in battle.

skillTree.localised_description: Mount and rider, together as one at their very cores. Indivisible.

skillTree.localised_description: You need to be at the very centre of this pack of furious monsters to have the minutest chance of controlling their rage. Good luck!

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
A Lord from the Lizardmen's hallowed First City can summon his spawn-kin to battle in Lustria's defence.
Through our acts, the gods will cleanse the lands.
The Lords rule, the peasants toil. Nothing has changed in over a thousand years.
Such long-lived creatures develop a level of guile that mortals cannot match.
Someone has to ensure the numbers and quality of recruits remain high.
"The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: The power generated by the overarching Geomantic Web can also be used to nourish the Saurus on the march.
This warrior has been ambushed previously and got themselves and many of their compatriots away safely. Such things make one naturally suspicious.
Life in the jungle means knowing the difference between which flora can heal and what, if ingested, will kill you.
This Lord's many deeds - both on and off the battlefield - have brought them renown among their allies and made them feared by their enemies.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

A Rampaging unit is uncontrollable and will attack the nearest enemy unit.
	When there are no enemy units nearby, a Rampaging unit will move around randomly instead.

A Rampaging unit is uncontrollable and will attack the nearest enemy unit.
	When there are no enemy units nearby, a Rampaging unit will move around randomly instead.

factionEffects.localised_description: The mighty protector of the Lizardmen goes wherever he is needed the most, his appearance a tangible portent that a battle of great importance is imminent.

effects.description: Nakai's horde unlocks units, while other hordes use global recruitment to get access to them
Nakai's vassals occupy the settlements conquered. More settlements controlled come with increasing rewards
Lord recruit rank: +3 for Kroxigor Ancients

items.colour_text: Every trinket adorning the Wanderer’s massive, battle-scarred body is a testament to the countless battles that he has fought.

item_set.name: Jungle Trinkets
item_set.description: When wandering the jungles of Lustria, one is bound to discover a variety of interesting baubles.

items.colour_text: The shard is a fractured piece of one of the original Ogham Waystones, whose mystical properties may keep Chaos at bay.

item_set.name: Jungle Trinkets
item_set.description: When wandering the jungles of Lustria, one is bound to discover a variety of interesting baubles.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Revered as the living embodiment of the jungle, Nakai is an ancient Kroxigor compelled to defend Lustria wherever and whenever it is threatened.

effects.description:
Recruitment cost: -15% for Kroxigor and Sacred Kroxigor units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +5 for Kroxigor and Sacred Kroxigor units
	(Lord's army)
